channel.title: Help! Ecrypted files!
channel.description:
Hi, I need help.
I need to know how to unencrypt files. The passwords for the accounts are ecrypted and it won't let me view them.
I am told that its possible to unencrypt the passwords, but it involves wiping all of the account info, and thats okay with me.
So if you guys could link me to a tutorial/website that will teach me or show me this, or if you could even tell me how here, that'd be wonderful.
Thanks so much!
-Hellman34[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 13, 2009, 10:37:18 pm[/size][hr]^Bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 13, 2009, 10:43:20 pm[/size][hr]Bump^

item.title: Help! Ecrypted files!
item.dc:creator: @Hellman34 Hellman34
item.description:
@Hellman34 wrote:

Okay so I’ve deleted everything pertaining to MD5, but its still encrypted. Help???[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 13, 2009, 11:23:51 pm[/size][hr]^bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2009, 09:36:04 pm[/size][hr]^bump

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Ecrypted files!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Yes, delete anything pertaining to MD5.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Ecrypted files!
item.dc:creator: @Hellman34 Hellman34
item.description:
@Hellman34 wrote:

Okay, I deleted something that said it was the encryption code, but the passwords are still encrypted (yes I deleted the accounts. I remade one and it was still encrypted.)

Do I need to delete EVERY MD5 code?

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Ecrypted files!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You need to remove the MD5 encryption, there is no tutorial for it on MSCP, however that other site has one.

Although, removing MD5 will ruin all of your character files. So all of your players must restart, or you must manually change their password.

Read full topic
